hints_html:
To count the number of zeroes in this number, it suffices to count the number of factors of 10 the number has.

To accomplish hint 1, notice that the number of factors of 2 inside \(\displaystyle n!\) must exceed the number of factors of 5 so it suffices to count the number of factors of 5 inside \(\displaystyle n!\).

The number of 5s occurring in the expansion of \(\displaystyle n!\) is given by

\(\displaystyle \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5} \right\rfloor + \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5^{2}} \right\rfloor + ... + \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5^{\lfloor \log_{5}(n) \rfloor}} \right\rfloor\)

This is true since you get a factor of 5 every 5 integers. You get another factor of 5 every 25 integers and so on.

$\displaystyle \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5} \right\rfloor + \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5^{2}} \right\rfloor + ... + \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5^{\lfloor \log_{5}(n) \rfloor}} \right\rfloor$

hints_raw:
To count the number of zeroes in this number, it suffices to count the number of factors of 10 the number has.
To accomplish hint 1, notice that the number of factors of 2 inside <math> \displaystyle n! </math> must exceed the number of factors of 5 so it suffices to count the number of factors of 5 inside <math> \displaystyle n! </math>.
The number of 5s occurring in the expansion of <math> \displaystyle n! </math> is given by

<math> \displaystyle \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5} \right\rfloor + \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5^{2}} \right\rfloor + ... + \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5^{\lfloor \log_{5}(n) \rfloor}} \right\rfloor </math>

This is true since you get a factor of 5 every 5 integers. You get another factor of 5 every 25 integers and so on.
sols_html:
The correct answer is c = 37.

Following the hints, we seek to count the number of factors of 10 in the number \(\displaystyle 153!\). To do this we count the number of 5s occuring in its expansion. The number of 5s occurring in the expansion of \(\displaystyle n!\) is given by

\(\displaystyle \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5} \right\rfloor + \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5^{2}} \right\rfloor + ... + \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5^{\lfloor \log_{5}(n) \rfloor}} \right\rfloor\)

This is true since you get a factor of 5 every 5 integers. You get another factor of 5 every 25 integers and so on. Counting this, we see that

\(\displaystyle \left\lfloor \frac{153}{5} \right\rfloor + \left\lfloor \frac{153}{5^{2}} \right\rfloor + \left\lfloor \frac{153}{5^{3}} \right\rfloor = 30 + 6 + 1 = 37\).
sols_latex:
The correct answer is \textbf{c = 37}.

Following the hints, we seek to count the number of factors of 10 in the
number $\displaystyle 153!$. To do this we count the number of 5s
occuring in its expansion. The number of 5s occurring in the expansion
of $\displaystyle n!$ is given by

$\displaystyle \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5} \right\rfloor + \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5^{2}} \right\rfloor + ... + \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5^{\lfloor \log_{5}(n) \rfloor}} \right\rfloor$

This is true since you get a factor of 5 every 5 integers. You get
another factor of 5 every 25 integers and so on. Counting this, we see
that

$\displaystyle \left\lfloor \frac{153}{5} \right\rfloor + \left\lfloor \frac{153}{5^{2}} \right\rfloor + \left\lfloor \frac{153}{5^{3}} \right\rfloor = 30 + 6 + 1 = 37$.
sols_raw:
The correct answer is '''c = 37'''.

Following the hints, we seek to count the number of factors of 10 in the number <math>\displaystyle 153! </math>. To do this we count the number of 5s occuring in its expansion. The number of 5s occurring in the expansion of <math> \displaystyle n! </math> is given by

<math> \displaystyle \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5} \right\rfloor + \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5^{2}} \right\rfloor + ... + \left\lfloor \frac{n}{5^{\lfloor \log_{5}(n) \rfloor}} \right\rfloor </math>

This is true since you get a factor of 5 every 5 integers. You get another factor of 5 every 25 integers and so on. Counting this, we see that 

<math> \displaystyle \left\lfloor \frac{153}{5} \right\rfloor + \left\lfloor \frac{153}{5^{2}} \right\rfloor + \left\lfloor \frac{153}{5^{3}} \right\rfloor = 30 + 6 + 1 = 37</math>.
statement_html:
Multiple Choice

The number of zeros at the end of the decimal representation of 153! is

  • (a) 28

  • (b) 33

  • (c) 37

  • (d) 62

  • (e) None of the above.
statement_latex:
\textbf{Multiple Choice}

The number of zeros at the end of the decimal representation of 153! is

\begin{itemize}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item
  (a) 28
\item
  (b) 33
\item
  (c) 37
\item
  (d) 62
\item
  (e) None of the above.
\end{itemize}
statement_raw:
'''Multiple Choice'''

The number of zeros at the end of the decimal representation of 153! is

* (a) 28
* (b) 33
* (c) 37
* (d) 62
* (e) None of the above.
